column1: 11D41797-8B6A-4F4E-9D18-7A7BA47CD52A#appfire#48CFB908-9EBF-4685-8634-5910D4008BB5#appfire#alarm.volume#appfire#100000#appfire##appfire#Alarm Volume#appfire#1#appfire#\N#appfire#2016-04-14 06:31:12.0#appfire#\N#appfire#2016-04-14 06:31:12.0#appfire#1#appfirenewline#33369D51-C249-4D36-9572-760A76691721#appfire#48CFB908-9EBF-4685-8634-5910D4008BB5#appfire#refresh.frequency#appfire#0#appfire#Refresh Time to reload this configuration file In a production environment
column2: if you want to debug a specific component you can change the Alarm Log Levels (for specific Target like File
column3: DB etc) of that specific components. Once the configuration is refreshed new Log Events will be written to the configured Target (File
column4: DB etc). This will help to isolate and troubleshoot a production environment without shutting down the application. #appfire#Refresh Frequency#appfire#1#appfire#\N#appfire#2016-04-14 06:31:12.0#appfire#\N#appfire#2016-04-14 06:31:12.0#appfire#1#appfirenewline#714BC625-3A67-41F6-A891-42550DE2E0D9#appfire#48CFB908-9EBF-4685-8634-5910D4008BB5#appfire#alarm.queue#appfire#0#appfire#Logging Framework is Asynchronous in nature. Log Events goes to the Queue first and connectors takes the event from the queue for processing. Event Queue Type 0 - Circular Queue (RECOMMENDED) 1 - Infinite Queue with Initial Capacity and events will be wrapped in Soft References (JVM will garbage collect these soft references when it runs out of memory). 2 - Infinite Queue (NOT RECOMMENDED)#appfire#Alarm Queue Type#appfire#1#appfire#\N#appfire#2016-04-14 06:31:12.0#appfire#\N#appfire#2016-04-14 06:31:12.0#appfire#1
